meanings.definition: A plant of the parsley family with fleshy, edible leaves and stems.
meanings.sent1: The samphire grew abundantly in the garden, its fleshy leaves shining in the sun.
meanings.sent2: I picked some fresh samphire to add a unique flavor to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbit tried to steal the samphire, thinking it was a tasty treat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the vibrant green of samphire, refreshing and full of life.
meanings.sent5: The scent of samphire filled the air, reminding me of seaside picnics.

meanings.definition: A plant of the rock samphire genus, Crithmum.
meanings.sent1: The rugged cliffs were adorned with clusters of rock samphire, clinging to the rocks.
meanings.sent2: The salty taste of rock samphire added a unique twist to the seafood dish.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous goat climbed the steep cliff to nibble on the rock samphire.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as the roots of rock samphire, firmly anchored in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The rock samphire swayed in the coastal breeze, a dance of resilience and beauty.

meanings.definition: A plant of the glasswort genus, Salicornia.
meanings.sent1: The marshes were teeming with vibrant green glasswort, also known as samphire.
meanings.sent2: The chef used pickled glasswort, or samphire, to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The curious ducks pecked at the glasswort, mistaking it for samphire.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like the delicate flowers of glasswort, also called samphire.
meanings.sent5: The glasswort, resembling samphire, painted the wetlands with a touch of emerald.
